title: What is the most common enemy faction facing the Imperium of Man? - Quora

response.answer_text: In terms of sheer numbers, it is the Orks. By themselves the Orks are the most prolific and numerous species in the galaxy, and are thus the most common threat to the Imperium. Next up would be the Tyranids, an extragalactic species slowly homing in on Holy Terra because of the great light the Emperor is powering to guide ships throughout the Warp. Then comes Chaos, the Imperium’s most sworn enemy, although with the latest Black Crusade defeated they’re less of a threat [EDIT: with Gathering Storm, Chaos retakes the list at top enemy; Cadia broke before the Guard did]. Next would be the rising Necron Dynasties, rising partly in response to the Tyranids — who threaten to consume all life, thus depriving them of their eventual organic bodies — and partly due to malfunctions and other mishaps that happened throughout sixty million years of slumber. Then the Tau, a rising little empire to the south-east of the Imperium’s borders, in Segmentum Ultima the largest of Imperial territories, but are unfortunately in the path of the latest advancing Tyranid fleets. Ideologically, they’re the next greatest threat after Chaos, as they poach people away with their idealistic principles. Last but not least the Eldar race as a whole, with the Dark Eldar even more insignificant as a threat, being pirates and all. The vast majority of the Craftworld Eldar want to be left alone, but there’s a newer faction called the Ynnari, which follow a reawakening Eldar god called Ynnead, who may challenge Slaanesh and destroy She Who Thirsts. With Lord Commander Guilliman in charge, much of the Imperium’s entropic and stagnant decay is going to disappear, revitalizing the entity as a whole, but he still faces significant pushback from the entrenched nobility and religious authorities, who’ve grown comfortable with their power. But the Imperium, as its own enemy, is somewhere between Orks and Tyranids. May the God Emperor protect us all.

Ork and Eldar pirates  Though the Orks are the most widespread species in the 40k galaxy the Eldar are the most mobile. Both pointy eared creations of the Old Ones also have an instinctual bloodlust that makes them unable to resist attack other sapients for fun. Now on the 40k tabletop most Eldar armies are from Craftworlds, but lore wise the outcasts and corsairs of the Craftworld roam all over the galaxy. Tabletop wise Eldar of all stripes are the most popular non-Imperium army so they’ll always show up in stories and campaigns to keep the fanbase happy. Keep in mind that Eldar outcasts who are just picking fights for fun still have the resources to wipe out the Imperial navy’s battle fleets too.  So while imperial forces could go “in this region of space there are orks, be on guard”, Eldar can attack from anywhere at any time, even Holy Terra has been sullied by their pointy feet. 40k Eldar are not your hippy Tolkien/D&D elves but more like orcs with good skincare and punctuation and even the space orks fall prey to their pirate raids (what exactly Eldar loot from orks isn’t detailed… maybe squig truffles). From within there’s Chaos cultists  They’re arguably the most common threat to the Imperium as xenos come from without but Chaos can tempt any one of the countless trillions of humanity. Half of the space marines fell to chaos y’know? Would be nice if the regular human cultists had more tabletop presence. New threats are… Tyranids- Attacking from beyond the galaxy, they’re huge in number but only focused within a few sectors, but still the Orks and Eldar have been a much older, more widespread threat to the imperium. Storytelling wise their lack of individuality strains the variety of scenarios they can appear in but genestealer cults have been making a comeback. Necrons- Awakening from millions of years of slumber they can pop up anywhere and are said to dwell even on Mars, but still the Orks and Eldar outnumber them. The ‘newcron’ fluff where they become Tomb Kings in Spaaace that can love and hate and laugh and rule over the living has added much greater flexibility to what kind of stories they show up in. Tau- New to space faring, they clash with the Ultramarines often but are isolated to their sector of the galaxy. Various Craftworld Eldar Farseers have good things to say about the Tau though and it would be a huge danger to the imperium if the Tau were given access to Eldar methods of travel…
